item.description:
Hi, Everybody:

Time to get the season underway here with the first of several hikes and picnics to this spot scheduled for the upcoming season!

We'll meet at 10:00 and do the Ring Trail loop to the top and back; this takes approximately 1 1/2 hours.  After that we'll hike a short distance across the street and into the woods again (another mile) enjoy a picnic on a quiet pond or under some pine trees - then another shorter walk - and then back.  Great views from the top (691 foot elevation - easy hike); and a nice relaxing picnic.

Here is the link to the Mount A trail:

http://www.agamenticus.org/recreation.html

Pack a large picnic lunch and beverages.  As we hikers know, now that it's late spring - strong insect repellent is always a necessity.  Bring sunscreen if you want.  Hiking shoes or boots with non-slip grips for wet rocks and pebbles are recommended.

Combined hike and picnic should last from 10:00 to around 01:30 or 02:00.  Let me know if you have any questions.   I'll send along the directions closer to the day.  For reference purposes, Mt. A. is about 1/2 hour north of Portsmouth, NH.

Randy
item.how_to_find_us: We'll gather near the large rocks at edge of Mount A parking lot.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike and Picnic at Mount Agamenticus!
